column4: My DVD ripped all the way to 51 minutes, then failed: what's wrong?
is there still room on the drive?
I mean was there room for the DVD rip to fit on the hard drive?
plenty, the encoded 51 minutes Theora file is only 600 megs, I have over 40 gigs left.
could it be the dual-layer transition?
it's possible... what program are you using to rip?
what's the program you're using, I'm pretty sure you can write an ISO using Brasero
what option did you choose in Brasero?
does ardchoille's solution work? come back if you need more help
the 1:1 copy should be what you want
dvdshrink defaults to a compressed version of the dvd
I lost the train of thought here, how's the DVD ripping going?
if you put our username in your responses it makes it easier for us to follow along :) for future reference
I've never used that package, but It think that ardchoille recommended it
I'm not sure... never used a screen recorder--if you don't have ethical objections perhaps a torrent would be less work
